title: World Internet Conference unveils leading cyberspace sci-tech achievements in Wuzhen of E China's Zhejiang
content:
Liu Yunjie, Academician of the Chinese Academy of Engineering, speaks during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
WUZHEN, Nov. 24 (Xinhua) -- Fifteen of the world's leading Internet scientific and technological achievements were unveiled Monday at the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum held in the water-town of Wuzhen in east China's Zhejiang Province.
The achievements, selected by a group of nearly 40 experts from around the world, cover post-pandemic industrial recovery and coordinated development, digital social governance, global public crisis response, cloud life based on artificial intelligence (AI) and other Internet-related fields.
The achievements include several that have helped in the fight against COVID-19, such as "Tech for Good: Communication for Boundless Collaboration," an experience based on the Tencent Meeting application by Tencent Cloud Computing (Beijing) Co., Ltd.
The "Tech for Good: Communication for Boundless Collaboration," an experience based on the Tencent Meeting application is unveiled during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
Also recognized are: "Big Data Platform for Epidemic Prevention, Control and Work Resumption" by the China Academy of Electronics and Information Technology of CETC; and "AI-based Covid-19 Prevention and Control: Overall Solution of Meituan Autonomous Delivery" by Beijing Sankuai Online Technology Co., Ltd.
The "Big Data Platform for Epidemic Prevention, Control and Work Resumption" is unveiled during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
The "AI-based COVID-19 Prevention & Control -- Overall Solution of Meituan Autonomous Delivery" is unveiled during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
Themed "Digital Empowerment for a Better Future: Building a Community with a Shared Future in Cyberspace," the two-day forum will include two main forums, five sub-forums, an expo and other activities, both online and offline.
The main forums will focus on new trends in cyberspace development, including science-based anti-COVID-19 measures, while the sub-forums will discuss international norms in cyberspace, the industrial internet and artificial intelligence.
A representative of Zhejiang University and Zhejiang Lab speaks about "Neuromorphic Computer with Hundreds of Million Neurons" during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
A representative of Alibaba Cloud presents Hardware-Software Co-design SHENLONG Architecture during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
A representative of Qi An Xin Technology Group Inc. speaks about "Build-in Security -- The New Generation of Enterprise Network Security Framework" during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
A representative of Huawei Technologies speaks about "Intelligent Twins: The Reference Architecture for Intelligent Upgrades" during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
A representative of Horizon Robotics speak about "Journey 2 by Horizon Robotics -- Automative-grade AI Processor for Intelligent Vehicles" during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
A representative of Microsoft presents Microsoft Surface Duo during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020. 
A representative of Galaxy Space presents the development of the Galaxy Space Launch Star and the verification of the 5G space-ground integration network during the World Internet Conference -- Internet Development Forum in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang Province, Nov. 23, 2020.
